summary: This is an email chain from March 30, 2021, discussing a 2019 court order related to an application to modify a protective order in a civil case involving Jeffrey Epstein. The order, which was supposedly sealed but is publicly available, was denied by Judge Netburn. The correspondence involves U.S. Attorney's Office personnel forwarding a Westlaw notification about the case.

persons.name: Judge Netburn
persons.context: The judge who denied an application to modify a protective order in a civil case related to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the civil case for which the sealed/unsealed order pertains.

events.title: Court order issued and later unsealed
events.description: A 2019 court order related to an application to modify a protective order in a civil case involving Jeffrey Epstein was issued and later unsealed.

events.title: Email discussion about the order
events.description: U.S. Attorney's Office personnel exchanged emails discussing the supposedly sealed but publicly available 2019 court order.

keyFacts: A 2019 court order related to Jeffrey Epstein civil case discovery materials was supposedly sealed but was publicly available.
Judge Netburn denied an application to modify a protective order in that civil case.
The document is an email chain from March 30, 2021, showing U.S. Attorney's Office personnel discussing the order's status.
The case reference is USAO Reference No. 2018R01618, titled 'IN RE APPLICATION TO UNSEAL CIVIL DISCOVERY MATERIALS.'
